title: Lyapunov exponent
summary: In mathematics, the Lyapunov exponent or Lyapunov characteristic exponent of a dynamical system is a quantity that characterizes the rate of separation of infinitesimally close trajectories. Quantitatively, two trajectories in phase space with initial separation vector Î´ Z 0 {\displaystyle \delta \mathbf {Z} _{0}} diverge (provided that the divergence can be treated within the linearized approximation) at a rate given by
